title: Spanish self assessment app serving five autonomous regions
description: Spanish government self assessment app in collaboration with Cantabria, Castile-La Mancha, Extremadura, Balearic Islands and the Region of Murcia.

notes.text: According to this website: https://www.interregeurope.eu/intencive/news/news-article/8297/new-app-for-covid-19-self-assessment-in-spain/

title: Canary Islands considers immunity passport to reopen tourism
description: After considering a digital health passport before Summer 2020, the Canary Islands government is once again studying an immunity passport. According to the newspaper El Diario, the Regional Government Tourism Council has submitted a query to the Health Department about this certificate to assess its viability as an accelerator of the sector.

notes.text: Last summer, the Canary Islands was also considering a digital health passport, as reported by Euractiv: https://www.euractiv.com/section/economy-jobs/news/canary-islands-spains-tourist-paradise-seeks-to-lead-revival-of-sector/

title: Eight telecoms providers agree to share mobile phone location data with the European Commission
description: According to Reuters, the Commission will use anonymised and aggregated mobile phone location data to coordinate measures tracking the spread of the virus.

involved_organisations: French National Institute of Health and Medical Research
title: Orange sharing telecom data in France
description: Orange sharing aggregated and anonymised location data with Inserm, the French National Institute of Health and Medical Research.

notes.text: Inserm Press Room: https://presse.inserm.fr/en/deploying-cellphone-data-to-fight-covid-19/38831/

title: Maladie Coronavirus: French symptom checker app
description: Symptom checker app

title: French government symptom checker
description: Government's symptom checker and self-assessment tool
data_storage_details: According to the website, no information that can identify you is collected.

title: UK considering using EE telecom data to track lockdown compliance
description: BT, owner of UK mobile operator EE, is in talks with the government about using its phone location and usage data to monitor whether coronavirus limitation measures such as asking the public to stay at home are working.

title: UK using O2 telecom data to track aggregated movement data, particularly in London
description: Telco providing anonymous smartphone location data so government can assess whether people are following social distancing guidelines

title: Thermavis launch AI-powered thermal scanner for workplaces
description: The non-intrusive scanner can accurately read the body temperature of up to six people at once with an accuracy of 0.5 degrees centigrade. The scanner can be used to help protect workers from COVID-19 by remotely detecting individuals with an elevated body temperature, one of the primary symptoms of the disease.

title: Wearable sensors for quarantined people in UK
description: Led by Imperial College London, in partnership with NHS organisations in northwest London, the sensor is being used to monitor people in quarantine at a special NHS facility near Heathrow airport, for example travellers from abroad or those wishing to travel to return home.

title: Stop Covid NI: Northern Irish contact tracing app
description: Starting from September, people under 18 can use the app as well.
data_storage_details: Decentralised

title: Greece uses drones to monitor lockdown compliance
description: The drones monitored people’s movements in Athens and Thessaloniki.

notes.text:
Announced by the General Secretariat for Civil Protection on March 22nd: 

https://www.civilprotection.gr/el/koini-synenteyxi-typoy-gia-ton-periorismo-kykloforias-politon-se-oli-tin-epikrateia-logo-koronoioy

involved_organisations: The Health and Social Care Board (HSCB)
title: COVID-19 NI: Irish symptom checker
description: Self assessment app that also provides information

notes.text: First version on App Store on March 27th

title: Luxembourg considering a possible contact tracing app
The Norwegian Institute of Public Health uses telecom data to track coronavirus spread
description: Telenor is sharing location data with the NIPH so the institute can predict how the virus will spread.

title: Info Praia: Portugal beach app
description: Tells users how much space available on the beach. No personal information required for use but does require location permission.

notes.text: This app already existed prior to Covid, updated in June 2020

data_storage_details: According to theportugalnews.com: ““All information collected, [about] location and favourite beaches, is stored exclusively on the user’s device and no personal information is transmitted to third parties or the [Environment Agency]”.

title: Serbia using telecom information to track quarantine
description: President Aleksandar Vučić said: "We monitor telephone numbers, primarily Italian ones. So, we do not eavesdrop, but we monitor whether people with Italian numbers are roaming - and they are moving".

title: OstaniZdrav: Slovenia launches contact tracing app
description: A company called RSteam helped Slovenia adapt the German app

title: Proposal to use PNR database Europe-wide
Facebook partners with University of Maryland for survey
description: University of Maryland researchers are teaming up with Facebook to provide the survey methodology muscle needed to obtain a much-needed global view of the worldwide COVID-19 crisis—where it’s growing, where it’s abating and where the next hot spot could develop.

title: Etihad Airways launches COVID-19 risk assessment tool
AMAN: Jordan contact tracing app
description: Exposure detection app
data_storage_details: Centralised

title: Bader: Jordan app
description: According to the Google Play Store, the app "supports Jordan Ministry of Health endeavours to track infected users interaction and quarantined person’s movement".

title: Tarassud: Oman self-assessment app
description: Symptom checker and information app

notes.text: First version on Apple Store on March 16th

title: Mawid: Saudi self assessment app
description: Symptom checker app developed by the Saudi Ministry of Health prior to the pandemic and later was adapted for COVID-19

notes.text: App existed prior to COVID, but media reported the new feature early April: https://www.arabnews.com/node/1652171/saudi-arabia
App existed prior to COVID, but media reported the new feature early April (https://www.arabnews.com/node/1652171/saudi-arabia)

title: Coronavirus Australia: Australian symptom checker app
description: Information and symptom checker app

involved_organisations: The federal Department of Prime Minister and Cabinet
title: Vodafone Australia provides location data to government
description: Dan Lloyd, Vodafone Australia's director of corporate affairs, told the Sun Herald the telco had "provided, on request, aggregated network information to the NSW Department of Customer Service and the federal Department of Prime Minister and Cabinet".

title: Melbourne’s police to use number plate recognition to enforce second lockdown
description: NSW police to use number plate recognition to detect people travelling to and from restrictted areas

title: Drones used to enforce Melbourne’s second lockdown
Drones used in Victoria state to spot people not wearing masks, to detect number plates too far from home and to guard the New South Wales border
description: Police to deploy drones in public areas to ensure mask-wearing, to recognize number plates that are far away from home

involved_organisations: Ministry of Health and Medical Services
title: CareFIJI: Fiji’s Bluetooth contact tracing app
description: Bluetooth tracing app used in Fiji
enforcement_details: Voluntary for residents, mandatory for arriving travellers
data_storage_details: Users share their phone numbers and contact tracers will use that to contact them if they are exposed to the coronavirus. The Privacy policy states: “Your personal information will be used for the sole purpose of enabling health officials to carry out contact tracing immediately and is limited to the following: sending you an SMS to confirm your mobile number or upload your encrypted and anonymised contact data; providing health officials with access to the registration information and contact data to enable contact tracing; and using encrypted user IDs in uploaded contact data to identify other careFIJI users that a positive COVID-19 user had contact with in a 28 day period.”

title: Birth control app Natural Cycles has added symptom tracker to its app

notes.text: https://businesscloud.co.uk/birth-control-app-launches-covid-19-symptom-tracker/
App says their scientists "may then also be able to study the data in anonymized form to better understand the spread and the effects of the virus in different parts of the world."

description: The app has received optional trackers to help track health if you feel sick and are experiencing potential COVID-19 symptoms. This will allow users to track their own symptoms in real time and share them with their healthcare provider. App says their scientists may analyze the data in anonymized format.

title: My Day for Seniors: daily Covid questionnaires via Alexa
description: My Day for Seniors, a well-being program available on Alexa devices, offers a COVID-19 screening module. A daily well-being questionnaire administered via Alexa assesses symptoms and communicates status to designated loved ones, caregivers and members of the health community.

title: Facebook expands location data sharing to help Covid researchers forecast virus spread
description: Facebook is expanding a program that grants researchers access to data about movement patterns in an effort to help improve our understanding of the spread of COVID-19. Data for Good, which uses aggregated, anonymized data from Facebook’s apps to inform academic research, will now grant access to three new maps for forecasting the disease’s spread and revealing whether residents of a given region are staying at home.

title: Facebook helps countries develop coronavirus chatbots

notes.text: Announced by Facebook: https://messengernews.fb.com/2020/03/23/messenger-partners-with-developers-to-provide-government-health-organizations-with-free-services-to-respond-to-coronavirus-pandemic/

description: Facebook launched a program to support government health organizations worldwide in combating the COVID-19 pandemic. Beginning this week, the company’s developer partners will provide free services to health organizations and UN health agencies to use Messenger — Facebook’s messaging service with over 1.3 billion users — to scale their response to the crisis.

title: Tencent launches chatbot tool for self-assessment

notes.text: https://www.scmp.com/abacus/news-bites/article/3078200/tencent-launches-covid-19-self-screening-program-international

description: The company has launched free online health consultation services via five online health-care platforms through WeChat. There is also a so-called “chatbot” which allows users to ask questions and get basic diagnosis. A chatbot is an automated messaging service.

title: EGOpro Active Tag: Art gallery uses wearables to detect social distance
description: The art gallery in Hudson Valley, New York, distributes wearable tags which visitors attach to a lanyard. They vibrate whenever someone comes within six feet of another person.

title: Pass Card: immunity passport developed by Pangea
description: According to the Times of Israel, Pangea's smart card/ immunity passport "comprises a photo of the holder, a digital signature, a chip, and a hologram. It can be securely linked to the country’s medical data base, the company said, and includes up-to-date encrypted data on the holder’s COVID-19 profile.

title: Chinese company Rokid’s temperature-reading glasses
description: By using an infrared sensor and camera, the glasses enable their users to "see" the temperature of people around them.

title: FinGo: Contact tracing system using "vein-scanning" technology
C-19 Tracer: BHP contact tracing app for us in the company’s mines
Pennsylvania launches COVID Alert PA App
description: App uses same technology as Irish contact tracing app, developed by Nearform
data_storage_details: Decentralised

involved_organisations: Public Health Agency of Canada and the Canada Border Services Agency
title: ArriveCan: app for travellers to submit information prior to arrival in Canada
description: Use ArriveCAN to provide mandatory travel information on and after your entry into Canada, applies to travellers arriving by air, land and sea. Travellers must submit contact information, travel document details and travel details, in addition to information on quarantine plans (quarantine is mandatory).

title: Hubbcat contracted to monitor quarantined people in Bahamas

notes.text: The government changed rules for incoming passengers and removed the mandatory quarantine

description: A 14-day quarantine period is mandatory for all incoming travelers to the Bahamas. Travelers have to officially declare their quarantine location to Ministry of Health officials at the airport, install the HubbCat App to help with contract tracing and stick with your group for the entire 14-day period.
enforcement_details: Mandatory. According to Forbes, anyone unwilling to install the HubbCat contact tracing app will be held in a government facility until they can be deported.

title: High Point University to launch contact-tracing app

related_legislations.details: Do have intelligence and data protection law. Old and insufficient. Don’t mention open-source intelligence.

title: Cyber-patrolling: Argentina monitoring "social mood" on social media to monitor compliance, prevent riots or demonstrations
Stay Home: UAE quarantine app
description: According to the government website, people placed under quarantine must enable the app’s access to camera, media, location, audio and calls for the app to work effectively. The Department of Health will periodically send notifications to the quarantined person asking them to check in to their location. The person has to take a selfie to finalise this check in.

title: G2G Now app: Voluntary quarantine app launched for interstate travellers
description: According to The Age: “If a person who consented to the app failed to respond to its request for a check-in three times, it would trigger a knock on the door from police to investigate any potential quarantine breach.” WA Police Acting Commissioner Gary Dreibergs told the paper: “Over a period of time we send push messages to you, it could be 2pm or 3pm, and what will happen, your phone will ring and you’ll pick it up and it will ask you to take a photograph of your face in a circle that’s spinning and you’ve got five minutes to take the photograph. When it takes that photo then it confirms your location [through your phone geo-location].”

title: Supermarket chain in Australia employs QR code contact tracing for shoppers
description: Contact-tracing system is available in Woolworths supermarkets in Victoria, NSW, ACT and Tasmania – with other states to follow soon. According to the store, if required, the state Department of Health will provide advice for people that visited that location on their website.
data_storage_details: The website said: “All details will be encrypted, securely stored and only be used to let customers know about a confirmed case in the store or to notify relevant health authorities and their nominated agencies for the purpose of contact tracing.”

title: NSW government's QR code check-in system
SAP and Deutsche Telekom are close to a deal with European Commission to build software platform to enable coronavirus smartphone apps to exchange information.
description: The European Commission is setting up an interoperability gateway service linking national contact tracing apps across the EU. In September, a group of Member States started testing the infrastructure connecting the backend servers of the official apps from the Czech Republic, Denmark, Germany, Ireland, Italy and Latvia.

title: São Paulo governor announces partnership with telecoms
description: On 9 April, the state governor João Doria,  announced the launch of a system in partnership with private telecom companies to check on stay-at-home compliance. By sharing location data from their mobile users, the telecoms enabled the government to produce isolation indexes and heat maps,  identifying in which areas of the state the population was not following the orders.

involved_organisations: The Coordination of the Indigenous Organizations of the Brazilian Amazon (COIAB) and the Amazon Environmental Research Institute (IPAM)
title: COVID-19 Indigenous Alert: app to alert indigenous communities to the spread of the coronavirus pandemic in their lands.
description: This collection of information, as well as directing our strategies and actions to combat COVID-19, has exposed the lack of notification from public authorities and the serious way in which the new virus affects us," said Mario Nicacio Wapichana, the deputy co-ordinator of COIAB.

title: Kuikuro indigenous community employs own contact-tracing app
description:
The Kuikuro indigenous group, in the Xingu region, adapted a mobile app to track suspected cases. The app, which was used prior to the pandemic to track archeological sites and crops, besides areas at risk of deforestation or wildfires, was developed by a transnational group of researchers and social scientists. 

In addition to the app, they took other actions such as isolating a house for patients and later inaugurated their own healthcare unit.

title: Suzhou City Code: Suzhou withdraws plans to turn health code into “civility code”
description: The Chinese city of Suzhou was planning to build on its coronavirus health code system to create a "civility code" which would rank citizens' behaviour. According to Global Voices, if citizens were found jay-walking or drunk-driving, points would be deducted. If they volunteered, they would get extra points. Suzhou city's public security bureau had said people with high scores would have more advantages in seeking employment, enrolling in schools, and accessing both public and private services. However after outcry, the city postponed the system’s launch although some people think it will return at a later date.

notes.text: Reported by Global Voices early September

title: Suishen Code: Suggestions Shanghai’s could use its health code as permanent digital ID
description: According to SCMP: "The Shanghai Municipal Health Commission said on Thursday that the city is now using its coloured health codes “as proof of personal identification”. The government said the code acts as “real” and “effective” proof of a user’s digital identity, which is backed by a sea of public data. It added that the codes will have “personalised” and “integrated” capabilities for different scenarios.”

notes.text: Idea initially proposed in June, began implementation in early September according to officials' announcement

alternative_uses.description: According to SCMP report, Shanghai's municipality might is now using its coloured health codes “as proof of personal identification”

title: Tianjin's Health Code
description: The health QR code, a certificate showing your health condition, is required to move around the city. Users can fill in a condition inquiry list via Wechat’s mini program, and a QR code will consequently be issued in green, orange, or red, signifying a traffic light system.

title: Beijing Health Code
description: According to SCMP: "The colour-based system... determines the user’s quarantine status based on factors like travel history, duration of time spent in an outbreak-stricken area and relationships to potential carriers of the virus

notes.text: Reported by SCMP in early March.

title: Wuhan Health Code

alternative_uses.description: Wuhan authorities propose to extend health code to integrate data from medical records, physical examinations and “lifestyle management”. According to pictures in the Hangzhou government’s press release, new health codes will rely on lifestyle-related data like how much a person drinks, smokes and exercises every day. The resulting tally is incorporated into a health score that generates a QR code with a correlating colour and ranking.

description: Users are assigned QR codes on their smartphones that come in either red, yellow or green. Each color indicates the likelihood someone had contact with the new coronavirus, with a green code letting someone travel freely and yellow and red codes indicating people must quarantine for up to two weeks. The codes are based on a combination of big data and user-submitted information that includes travel history and whether someone has experienced symptoms.

title: Zhejiang Health Code
description: Hangzhou, capital of Zhejiang province, was one of the first places to implement health codes after lockdown ended in mid-February.

title: Jiangsu Health Code
description: The health QR code, a certificate showing your health condition, is required to move around the city. Users can fill in a condition inquiry list via Wechat’s mini program, and a QR code will consequently be issued in green, orange, or red, signifying a traffic light system.

title: Anhui Health Code
China’s Universal Studios theme park due to open in Beijing next year plans to use facial recognition technology.
Bogota uses ad data to warn people of Covid exposure
description: According to Rest of World: “Bogotá did not only run geotargeted ads on Facebook and Instagram in the neighborhoods it deemed more at risk; officials also used the data to understand how the virus was moving within city limits and how residents were socially isolating.”

title: Antioquia regions using ad data to locate sick people
description: According to Rest of World: "According to Quiceno, every week, health officials in Antioquia send Servinformación a list of Covid-19 patients and their home addresses. The company first looks for IDs that usually spend the night at these locations. Then, the company searches for IDs found at least 10 meters from the patients’ devices for 30 minutes or more, and also for IDs that might have mingled with them and were at least 10 meters away from them for at least half an hour. Servinformación then blasts both sets of IDs with ads on social media and mobile games, asking the phones’ users to check for any Covid-19 symptoms.”

title: Contact tracing website launched for Berlin clubs
description: Club-goers in Berlin must visit the CloseContact website before their night out and enter their details in order to receive a QR code pass. The QR code is then scanned on entry into various clubs. According to the close contact website, the system was developed by a group of engineers, lawyers, designers and music lovers from the music tech industry, with additional help from the Berlin Club Commission and a handful of venues.
data_storage_details: According to DJ mag, contact details are encrypted and passes are deleted automatically from the club's records after 30 days, and will only be shared with health authorities to contact clubbers regarding infections.

title: GVA Coronavirus: Symptom checker for the Community of Valencia
description: App works as a self-assessment and information app and also connects users to health services to book appointments if necessary

involved_organisations: Department of Health of the Government of Navarra
title: CoronaTest Navarra: Online symptom questionnaire for people living in Navarra
data_storage_details: The use of CoronaTest Navarra implies giving access to your data to health professionals as well as "suppliers and collaborators". The privacy policy suggests users data will be made confidential before it is passed to these third parties.

notes.text: First version on Apple Store on April 4th.

description: Aiming to reduce overload on health services, the app answers common questions about COVID and offers an initial triage and follow-up actions if necessary.

involved_organisations: Department of Health of the Government of Aragon
title: Salud Informa: Covid questionnaire for people living in Aragon
description: On March 25, the region of Aragon added updated its regional health app (used to book medical appointments) to include a questionnaire for self-assessment of Covid19 symptoms.

title: SACYL CONECTA: Castile-Leon symptom checker app
description: Regional symptom checker app, for use in Castile-Leon

involved_organisations: Finnish Institute for Health and Welfare
title: Koronavilkku: Finland launches contact tracing app
description: Koronavilkku is a contact tracing app produced by the Finnish Institute for Health and Welfare (THL) to help you find out whether you may have been exposed to coronavirus. Minors are also allowed to download the app.
data_storage_details: According to the app’s website, Koronavilkku does not store your name, date of birth or contact information. It cannot identify you or the people you come into contact with. The app does not collect information about where you are.

title: In France, infrared cameras are being used in public schools and city halls to measure the temperatures of passersby
description: In France, infrared cameras are being used in public schools and city halls to measure the temperatures of passersby

title: Nice police employ cameras with loudspeakers to monitor and alert pedestrians on COVID rules
description: In Nice, police use cameras with speakers to watch people and remind them of coronavirus rules. “In the event of a brawl or large grouping, for example, the city's police can talk directly to the people concerned and shout 'Watch out! We can see you, a crew is coming,'" Anthony Borré, Nice's deputy mayor in charge of security, told local newspaper Nice Matin.

title: Pepper: a robot that can detect if you are wearing a mask and remind you to one on if you are not is being used in shops, exhibitions and public spaces.
description: Pepper is a 120cm tall robot that can scans the faces of people approaching it, and if it detects the lower half of their face is uncovered, it says: “You have to always wear a mask properly.” It is not clear in what countries the technology is being used.

title: The BCB Beach Check app for beaches in England’s southwest
description: According to sponsored content on The Telegraph: “Data for the app is provided via a number of sources, including seafront rangers, CCTV and some footfall counters. At the start of the day, a prediction is set for each zone, based on previous data, factoring in the date and weather to forecast how busy each zone is likely to be.”
data_storage_details: No app-specific privacy policy

title: Tracepass: screening app for workplace COVID monitoring
description: "Tracepass is a secure mobile application and real-time dashboard designed to allow employers to screen their employees effectively in the workplace. Tracepass can be used in any industry, particularly if their workforces are spread globally."

title: ScribePro Team App made available to Scottish football teams
description: According to the Scotsman, each morning the app invites players and backroom staff to update information via phone which is then automatically stored on to their personal medical records and shared with the respective medical teams to provide accurate up-to-date screening information and contact tracing.

title: Protect Scotland: Scotland’s contact tracing app launched
data_storage_details: Decentralised
description:
The Protect Scotland app from NHS Scotland’s Test and Protect is a free, mobile phone app designed to help us protect each other and reduce the spread of coronavirus.

The app will alert you if you have been in close contact with another app user who tests positive for coronavirus. And if you test positive, it can help in determining contacts that you may have otherwise missed while keeping your information private and anonymous.

Using the Protect Scotland app, along with sticking to current public health measures, will help us to stay safe when we meet up, socialise, work or travel. This postcode checker will show you the current restrictions in your local area.

Downloading and using Protect Scotland will never be a requirement. However, as we see the rate of infection start to rise, it is important that we all download and use the Protect Scotland app to help stop the spread of coronavirus. We know the more of us that do, the more effective it will be.

involved_organisations: The African Union and the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention
title: PanaBIOS: Cross-border health screening and contact tracing in Africa
description: PanaBIOS ensures that travelers are able to use test results from one country to satisfy port clearance requirements in another country through their personal PanaBios app or by adding a system-generated SMS/USSD passcode to another travel document. So far, the platform is only being used in Ghana but the African Union is encouraging adoption by more member states.

title: Israeli Harmony Smart app: “privacy-preserving” quarantine enforcement
description: Israeli company Synel pitched their product, an app that tracks the digital presence of people in quarantine without using their smartphone’s microphone or camera, to the government. They said their app cannot access any hardware on users’ phones because it is based on GPS data.

title: Traveller Tracking System (TTS) used in state of Telangana
description: According to local media, travelers arriving in the state via trains, planes, etc get “screened” in order to record their travel history, symptoms, positive contacts if any, home address. All this information is then geotagged and shared with the district administration as well as to individual police stations to enable home- quarantine the traveler if no symptoms are found, or to immediately hospitalize the person if symptoms are detected.

notes.text: Reported April 1st: https://telanganatoday.com/telangana-employs-geo-tracking-to-monitor-foreign-returnees

title: Unmaze: quarantine app used by Indian police
description:
Innefu has created an app, internally called Unmaze, that will be leveraged by the authorities to keep people indoors. According to Mint: " Consumers will have to download the app and the authorities will update records of infected patients on the backend. Using this data, the app maps GPS locations of phones and tells users whether they came within 5-10 metres of a COVID-positive patient."

The company that makes the platform told media three unspecified police departments were planning to use the platform. The company also created Delhi Police’s Automated Facial Recognition Software.

title: Intugine's Location Intelligence Platform used for quarantine enforcement in Indian states
description: The states of Maharashtra, Arunachal Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Goa and Madhya Pradesh are using software that enables them to monitor large numbers of quarantined people through a single dashboard, to ensure people are following social distancing norms and adhering to quarantine orders. System doesn't require any app download
data_storage_details: Data apparently stored on “secure servers”

title: nCOVID-19 Nagaland quarantine app used in India’s northern Nagaland state
description: The app says it shows authorities where quarantined individuals have been. It also includes a self-assessment function.

title: AiiHealth: Contact tracing app and USSD code
description: Users who share data gain access to a health-mapping system and authorities can send alerts if they have come into contact with someone who has tested positive. People who don't have smartphones can use USSD codes, aided by telecom operators. The function is available within the Aiisma data marketplace.
data_storage_details: According to Tandem Research: While it is one of the few apps to work on feature phones, its function is deeply concerning as it appears to be purely a data marketplace under the guise of being anti-COVID app. It relies on anonymised information, although there are established concerns around the reliability of anonymisation. This brings to the fore every concern around data protection and privacy.

title: Corona Watch Karnataka information and infection map app
data_storage_details: According to Tandem Research: Concerns around the app have been with regard to an excessive need for permissions such as device IDs, details about WiFi connections, and the phone status and identity, which are not required for its functioning. Additionally, lists generated out of the use of the app were made public by the Karnataka government raising concerns around the privacy and rights of individuals on the list.

notes.text: Reported on March 28th: https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/karnataka/corona-watch-app-launched/article31193062.ece

description: Shows locations of COVID Patients and their movement history of 14 days. General Public can use this to identify their movements in that area. Also indicates the nearest health center

title: Kerala police to use drones to enforce coronavirus rules
description: Kerala police to use drones to surveil adherence to physical distancing and use of masks. According to the Hindu, the police would patrol public places and residential neighbourhoods to detect violators of the epidemic control Ordinance and slap fines or effect arrests, if necessary.

title: In Delhi, commuters must show that they are symptom-free with a mobile health app before boarding the subway, flights and to enter some offices.
description: More details needed.

title: My Slots: Contact tracing app for businesses
description: My Slots’ is a smartphone application that allows visitors to shops or offices scan a QR codes to help them identify all the places they went incase they test positive for coronavirus. Unclear if the app is in-use.

title: New Dehli proposes using drones for social distance enforcement
description: AP reports: “Police will enforce physical distancing and prevent the mixing of the population inside more than 200 containment zones in the capital, where large clusters of cases have been confirmed. Surveillance cameras or drone monitoring will also be used.”

title: Italian city of Como has installed dozens of facial recognition cameras to monitor crowds for social distancing violations.
Quarantine bracelets for travellers arriving in Jordan
description: According to the Jordan Times, People arriving in Jordan must isolate for 14 days at designated hotels then they must self-isolate for an additional 14 days at home where they must use the quarantine bracelet. The bracelet connects to a person’s phone via Bluetooth with GPS enabled, a source told Roya. It is unclear if the bracelet is linked to one of Jordan’s apps.

notes.text: https://www.jordantimes.com/news/local/jordan-slaps-wristbands-arrivals-monitor-virus-quarantine

title: Bus shelters in Seoul equipped with thermal imaging cameras
description: Seoul's Seongdong-gu district rolled out 10 bus shelters powered by solar energy and equipped with ultraviolet sterilizers and thermal imaging cameras that check temperatures. Ten more such shelters are planned.

title: The Cayman Islands uses wearables called Bio Buttons to enforce quarantine for incoming travellers
description: The wearable is designed to catch early Covid symptoms among incoming travellers, after the country reopens its borders. Incoming travellers will be asked to wear a BioButton for 14 days and self-isolate at a residence of their choice for five days before taking another test. If negative, they will continue their bio-monitoring for a further nine days without needing to self-isolate.

title: Lithuania launches Korona STOP
description: Using the mobile application "Korona Stop LT" we can stop the spread of the virus much faster. Join the international coronavirus alert system by installing the app on your smartphone.

title: Lithuania quarantine app
description: The app was announced as a “national” app in April. But since, the State Data Protection Inspectorate ordered the app be suspended in May but it is still available on the Google Play Store and the government said they never purchased the app. Apparently, there is also a pay dispute ongoing.

notes.text: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.lympo.covid19&hl=en_US, https://www.lrt.lt/naujienos/verslas/4/1190811/kurejai-ir-nvsc-stoja-i-musi-del-pinigu-buvo-ar-nebuvo-pazadetas-atlygis-uz-startuolio-karantinas-sukurima

title: CovidPass: Blockchain immunity passport
description: Created by a Morrocan entrepreneur, CovidPass uses blockchain technology to store encrypted data from individual blood tests, allowing users to prove that they have tested negative for COVID-19.

title: QR-code wristbands for everyone entering the eastern state of Sarawak
Itoju: Nigerian Coronavirus website enabling people to report “suspicious activity”
description: The website includes an infection map, information about the virus and a reporting system where users can report “suspicious activity”.

title: CoronaMelder: Dutch Contact tracing app launched
description:
You can pass coronavirus on to other people even if you do not have symptoms. The earlier you find out that you have (or could have) coronavirus, the easier it is to make sure you do not pass it on to other people. The CoronaMelder app helps you do this.

If you receive a notification from the app, you should stay at home for 10 days after the date of contact with an infected person. This way, you can avoid infecting your parents or grandparents, for example. And you can avoid spreading the virus in busy places, such as a market or sports event.

title: Peru SMS survey
description: “After 104 days of lockdown, a measure that has severely mashed the economy, the government launched its national Covid-19 survey in June, describing it as important to “track the behaviour of the corona”,  and asked the citizens to help by letting the state track their location using the GPS that comes in the smart phones.”
data_storage_details: The survey’s privacy policy said personal data would be kept “only during the state of emergency that had been decreed by the government” or “until that you decide to revoke your consent”.

title: Philippine police plan to monitor social media for quarantine breakers
description: “Police could use public postings on social media as leads,” Guillermo Eleazar, head of a task force charged with enforcing quarantine protocols, told Reuters.

title: TraceFast: Philippines’ contact tracing app using “Gapple” system
description: The Manila Bulletin “reached out to Multisys to clarify if TraceFast is just a rebranding of their original contact tracing system. According to a company representative, TraceFast is a different app from StaySafe.ph.
data_storage_details: Decentralised

title: Two Filipino companies relaunch the SafePass app
description: SafePass, a Filipino-made digital COVID-19 incident mitigation and management solution, is now available to all organizations – be it small or big businesses and establishments. It offers two types of free plans: SafePass Base, which features basic contact-tracing and digital health questionnaires; and SafePass Express, which comes with employee management features, and is free for government agencies and for establishments accredited by the Department of Tourism.

title: Vaccify: Pakistani immunity passport app
description: Plans for the app function around the idea that people can go to an accredited hospital, get tested, and receive their verification digitally on the app. The approach is blockchain-based and Vaccify’s certificates will be decentralised and tamper-proof. Because of this, the certificate will be trusted both nationally and internationally.
data_storage_details: According to Tech Juice PK: "The approach is blockchain-based and Vaccify’s certificates will be decentralised and tamper-proof.”

notes.text: TrustNet is working on a digital vaccination verification solution along with many other global tech companies on a platform called CovidCreds.

involved_organisations: Telecom with National Information Technology Board
title: COVID-19 Gov PK: Pakistani self-assessment app and map
description: Self-assessment app that then locates infected people on a map

title: Tawakkalna: Saudi permit app
description: According to MIT: “Tawakkalna app pairs with Tabaud, the contact tracing app, and allows citizens to request "movement permits" for mobility around the city.”

involved_organisations: Saudi Data and Artificial Intelligence Authority
title: Tabaud: Saudi contact tracing app
description:
Based on the keenness of the Government of Saudi Arabia, may God bless it, to maintain the health and safety of its citizens and residents from the risk of Coronavirus spreading; The Saudi Data and Artificial Intelligence Authority (SDAIA) has launched "Tabaud" application to support government efforts in tackling Coronavirus.

According to the health system and its implementing regulations (in Saudi Arabia), the Ministry of Health has approved health standards on which the "Tabaud" application has been developed. The characteristics and functions of this application will be subject to any additional instructions issued in implementation of the regulations and provisions of Saudi Arabia, in order to achieve the health and safety goals envisaged in developing the application by involving individuals to control Coronavirus outbreak, and limit its spread, in order to gradually reduce the restrictions imposed on social life and other activities.

The "Tabaud" application is a way to notify those who are in contact with people infected with coronavirus, so individuals can download and use "Tabaud" application to achieve the health and safety purposes of developing the application,

The application sends camouflaged identifiers data to the smart phones using the same application, which were registered during the contact with people infected with Coronavirus, accompanied by the data of the infected people devices, in accordance with the policies that the two international companies (Google and Apple) maintained, while maintaining the full privacy of users.

The application enables the user to receive direct and proactive notifications in case of any registered infected person has been detected, for the purpose of requesting direct health support from the Ministry of Health (in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia).

title: Travellers arriving in Singapore from certain countries can quarantine at home if they wear an electronic monitoring device
description: Arrivals from certain countries can quarantine at home if they wear a wearable device for 14 days that ensures they don’t go out.

title: Singapore police trial social distance detecting drones
description: The pilot free drones are programmed to track anomalies such as gatherings and stream footage to the police. According to the Israeli company that made the drones, this is the first time automated commercial drones have been approved to fly over a major metropolis.

notes.text: Reported by Reuters early August: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-israel-drones/dont-stand-so-close-singapore-trials-automated-drones-to-check-idUSKCN2521K3

title: Singapore's Universal Studios deploys facial recognition for entry
description: “Facial recognition provides contactless verification of tickets and ticket holders, enabling our customers to enjoy our park experience in a more efficient and seamless manner,” Resorts World Sentosa (the company which owns the sprawling area of tourist attractions, hotels and restaurants in which the park sits) said in an emailed statement to Reuters.

involved_organisations: Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth Singapore
Singapore Defence Science and Technology Agency
title: In Singapore, touch-free kiosks with thermal sensors at busy bus stops and train stations allow passengers to check their temperature before boarding.
description: A green light indicates they are free from fever, while an orange light shows a high temperature.

notes.text: First reported June 24th: https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/contactless-self-check-temperature-kiosks-to-be-rolled-out-at-70-bus-interchanges-and-mrt

title: In Singapore, the SGWorkPass dictates which migrant workers are allowed to leave their dormitories and resume work.
description: According to local media, a worker who has received approval to resume work will see a green AccessCode on their SGWorkPass app once they meet the following conditions: both the worker and the dorm he lives in must be Covid-19-free, and his employer must have received approval to resume work as well. To download SGWorkPass, users must also have registered on the TraceTogether contact tracing app.

title: Slovenia developing an app to track children placed in quarantine
description: Unclear whether the app would publish the individual children in quarantine or just aggregated data from schools.

title: DDC Care: the app monitors the user’s health and asks for travel history as well as people they have been in contact with
description: App requires the user (those who have been diagnosed by the hospital or the disease screening point in Thailand, including the airport, that they are at risk of being infected) to submit a self-assessment report directly to DDC during the 14-day detention period. They must also report travel history and backlog of people whom they've been in contact

title: Taiwanese software FaceMe Health can detect if a person is wearing a mask
description: The FaceMe Health tool could be used to detect whether people are wearing masks and take their temperature before giving them a green light to enter a store. “Right now we’re having lots of inquiries from retail stores, restaurants, and the hospitality space because those businesses are badly hurt and they need to reopen and find solutions,” a company representative told Forbes.

notes.text: Reported August 18th: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20200818005041/en/CyberLink-Introduces-FaceMe%C2%AE-Health-to-Detect-Masks-Verify-Identity-and-Measure-Temperature-for-Pandemic-Control

title: Alabama State University uses smart thermal temperature cameras
description: These devices screen for COVID-19 symptoms, reads biomarkers such as temperature, heart rate and respiratory rate by quickly scanning the image of a person’s face.
data_storage_details: No data is stored

title: Volunteers in Hawaii tracking tourists breaking quarantine
description: According to AP, as of June 20th, a Facebook group called “Hawaii Quarantine Kapu Breakers: had helped police find and arrest around 35 people on the islands. The report details how one tourist was tracked for 14 days.

title: Public safety app Citizen adds an exposure notification function
description: The company is incentivising downloads by also offering covid tests to anyone who has been exposed for $140. In September, L.A. County Public Health Director Barbara Ferrer encouraged citizens to download the app.
data_storage_details: CNBC Reports: “To address privacy concerns, all contact tracing and health data is anonymized, encrypted and stored for only 30 days.”

involved_organisations: The University of Alabama at Birmingham
title: GuideSafe™ Event Passport
description: According to the GuideSafe website: “GuideSafe™ Event Passport is used to facilitate access to meetings, events, or facilities having ten or more people. Event attendees will complete Healthcheck, a COVID-19 assessment tool, prior to entering their event. Event passport is issued based on a proprietary risk algorithm factoring your daily healthcheck assigned risk level. After you have completed Guidesafe™ Healthcheck, press the “Passport” button to get your passport. Your passport is valid for the day. Each user is assigned a unique passport number indicating their status for the upcoming event which will show a “Clear” screen or “Not Clear” screen.”

title: SenseGiz technologies company launches wearables to enforce social distancing and also help with contact tracing
description: The wearables buzz if people get too close to one another, the system also alerts bosses to “serial violators”. There are inactivity alerts in case someone takes off the wearable. Geo-fence function can also be implemented to monitor people placed under quarantine.

title: Hawaii Safe Travels system
description: Incoming travellers to Hawaii must create an account with a system called SafeTravels, entering their personal information in order to get a QR code that will help them pass through the airport. 24-hours before their flight, they must complete a travel health questionnaire about any symptoms. Once they are in Hawaii, they must undergo 14day quarantine, during which they will receive daily check-ins.

title: COVID Trace Nevada app launches

Symptom checker app for Georgia Tech University
data_storage_details: “No personal information is being collected, but the aggregated data should be useful to help campus health authorities identify trends in the types of symptoms on campus,” says Jon Duke, director of Georgia Tech’s Center for Health Analytics and Informatics.

title: Carnegie Mellon’s Exposure Notification app
description: According to Georgia Tech, a university deploying the app: “NOVID leverages a combination of ultrasound and Bluetooth technology to note other devices that are within 6 feet, and only if they remain that close for 15 minutes or more. By briefly using the device’s microphone and measuring the time sound takes to travel, ultrasound can accurately measure the distance between devices. The benefit of this combined method is avoiding false positives that would be generated from Bluetooth alone, such as contacts that may be on the other side of a wall – nearby, but not creating a risk of exposure.”
data_storage_details: According to the NOVID website: “We have taken careful steps to design an anonymous-yet-social framework that works without using personal information. So, our collected information is already fundamentally at a higher level of privacy than what you provide when you buy anything online (giving your physical mailing address). Our databases and computer systems are designed so that even if anyone hacked into them (or if a government required us to provide the information), they would not be able to find out who you are.”

title: New York’s Rochester Institute of Technology requires Daily Health Screen
description: Students, teachers and staff at New York’s Rochester Institute of Technology must complete the RIT Daily Health Screen every day, seven days a week, whether or not they are coming to campus.

title: Perry Township Schools, in Indianapolis, is planning to use an AI system to enforce safe social distancing and detect when students are less than six feet apart.;

description: Originally launched as a mandatory measures, the university administration u-turned to make the tech voluntary after backlash led by students.

title: Private Las Vegas school adopts thermal AI as students return to class
description: The Remark AI Thermal Kit, from Remark’s bio-safety business, is an all-inclusive solution that allows for fast, touch-free scanning of multiple students (up to 120 people per minute) as they enter through established access points on a school campus. The private school in Las Vegas is the first in the US to adopt the Remark AI Thermal Kits.

title: Uber launches facial recognition tool to verify riders are wearing a mask
description: Not all riders will be asked to verify they are wearing a mask, only if a driver previously reported they are not wearing a mask or they haven’t used the app for a while.
data_storage_details: Uber stores selfie photos for 96 hours to settle potential disputes, but then permanently deletes them, a spokesman told Reuters.

An exposure notification app developed by Carnegie Mellon University.
Georgia Tech University in New York uses a Bluetooth contact tracing app called  that boasts “ultrasonic” technology that apparently makes their tracking system extra accurate.
data_storage_details: NOVID captures no personally identifiable information from people using it.

title: Georgia Tech University’s COVID Central web app to check students’ symptoms
description: Online platform where students and faculty can answer a daily questionnaire on symptoms of COVID and receive instructions on what to do next.
data_storage_details: “No personal information is being collected, but the aggregated data should be useful to help campus health authorities identify trends in the types of symptoms on campus,” says Jon Duke, director of Georgia Tech’s Center for Health Analytics and Informatics.

title: Covid Alert South Africa: South Africa launches Bluetooth contact tracing app
Corona Fighter: Access Management App
description: According to the developer: "A stand-alone web app which allows clients to secure their building access points. This app scans employee and visitor QR codes issued by the bot to ensure they are cleared for entry, the access manager then inputs the user's temperature and confirms they are wearing a mask before the app grants or denies entry.”

title: Corona Fighter: Management Dashboard
description: According to the developer: "The management dashboard is a standalone web-app that allows managers to assess the risk in their organisation at a glance. It also alerts Health Managers to incidents and has full case management functionality, including document management, quarantine timelines, medical history etc. Health managers can see symptom progression over time at both an individual and organisational level to properly respond to incidents.”

title: CoronaFighter: Symptom checker
description: Citizens can access the website to fill a questionnaire to conduct a self-assessment of symptoms. In the same platform, they can track symptoms daily, see latest guidelines and follow the more updated statistics

title: Immunity passport app for truck drivers in East Africa
description: Once drivers are tested, a digital health certificate will be generated and valid for 14 days so it can be checked at designated stops along the driver's routes. According to the New Times, “Designated stop locations will be geofenced in the App and Regional Electronic Cargo Tracking System platform. Any prolonged stop outside these locations will issue an alert or warning to the authorities and truck owners of the violation.”

notes.text: https://www.newtimes.co.rw/news/regional-electronic-cargo-tracking-system-launched

title: The Africa Communication and Information Platform for Health and Economic Action
description: According to reports: "Launching the service, the UN's Economic Commission for Africa said it provided two-way communication between citizens and health authorities, and had the potential to reach 80 per cent of Africa’s mobile users at no cost to the individual… One of the platform’s primary use cases is to collect health information from individuals, allowing authorities to identify local outbreaks and virus hotspots. It also provides advice and support to those affected.”

description:
Researchers at the University of São Paulo are developing an AI-system that will be able to recognize if a patient is going through respiratory problems only by voice. If well-succeeded, the tool will help in the triage of COVID-19 patients in health services. 

To teach the AI, researchers have collected voices of over 5,000 patients admitted to the university hospital but are also receiving input from volunteers, who can contribute through a form.
title: Brazilian researchers work on AI tool to detect COVID by voice

notes.text: First reported by USP's own publication: https://jornal.usp.br/ciencias/live-ciencia-usp-descobrindo-o-coronavirus-pela-pela-voz-e-pela-saliva/

description: After a successful pilot phase, the European Commission launched an interoperability gateway service linking national contact tracing apps across the EU. In the first phase, the gateway links Germany's Corona-Warn-App, Ireland's COVID tracker, and Italy's immuni, which together account for 2/3 of all app downloads in the EU
title: European Commission launches interoperability gateway service linking national COVID apps

related_legislations.details: According to Section 5 (3) of the Epidemic Act, at the request of a district administrative authority, all persons, such as in particular doctors, laboratories, employers, family members and staff from community facilities, who could contribute to the surveys, are obliged to provide information. Even if such a transmission of data (telephone number) by the Red Cross to the responsible district administrative authority is not intended and is also not technically implemented, we could be forced to provide your telephone number. Should such a case occur, the legal basis is Art 6 Paragraph 1 lit c in conjunction with Art. 9 Paragraph 2 lit i GDPR.
